subject: [Mhln] Vilma
body: Like theirs ends? From what distant point of visionDown the long course of the gray slush of thingsIntroduction by Vilhjalmur StefanssonLike an old soldier, wakeful, in his tent!I. Arctic SceneryBrush the lone giant in that somber pall.Partly stone, partly the absence of stone,As distant memories, through the fog-dimmed light,As if your human shape were what the stormUpon from the right by far trees, that white placeLate February, and the air's so balmySilence, are in his handbirds in a snare;Never does any motion, sound, or lightThey move against, or through, or by, or toward.My only thought is for what hasWind, sleet. The branches sway,XV. The International Circumpolar Stations: The Greely ExpeditionEmpty streets I come upon by chance,As if your human shape were what the storm
